bibl.title: From the Governor
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court of Washington Territory, Second Judicial District

div1.p: UNITED STATES O FAMERICA, TERRITORY OF WASHINGTON. EXECUTIVE DEPARTMENT.
To all whom these Presents shall Come---Greeting:

WHEREAS demand has been made upon me by His Excellency O.M. Roberts Governor of the State of Texas for the delivery of one J. Wallack a fugitive from justice from the said State of Texas being charged with the crime of "Forgery" committed in the county of Shackelford in said State of Texas.

Now, thereofre, I, Elisha P. Ferry Governor of the Territory of Washington, by virtue of the authority in me vested, do hereby authorize and empower JOhn G. Justice Agent named in said demand, to take the said J. Wallack wherever he may be found in this Territory, and transfer him to the line thereof at the expense of the said State of Texas.
And I hereby command all civil officers within the said Territory of Washington to afford all needful assistance, for the execution of the warrant.
In testimony whereof I hereto set my Hand and caused the Great Seal of the said Territory to be affixedd this 27th day of May A.D. 1880, and of the Independence of the United States, the 104th
By the Governor: W.H. Cumings Secretary of the Territory
